summary.para: Keeps the Shell items that are passed in.

param.name: pArray
param.para: A pointer to an array of. The array will contain more than one item if method returned SYNCMGR_RA_KEEP_MULTIPLE in parameter pdwAbilities.

param.name: pFeedback
param.para: When this method returns, contains a value.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The value returned in pFeedback determines how the next conflict is resolved. If this method fails, an error message is displayed and the user is asked how to proceed.

summary.para: Replaces the versions in conflict with a different Shell item that is usually a merged version of the originals.

param.name: pFeedback
param.para: When this method returns, contains a value.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The specified Shell item that replaces the Shell item(s) in conflict may not have been one of those originally in conflict. It may be a merged copy, or a replacement copy.
The value returned in pFeedback determines how the next conflict is resolved. If this method fails, an error message is displayed and the user is asked how to proceed.

param.name: pFeedback
param.para: When this method returns, contains a value.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Determines what options the conflict presenter will display.

param.name: pdwAbilities
param.para: When this method returns, contains one of the enumerated type.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The handler exposes how a conflict can be resolved by calling this method. The result of this method determines what options the conflict presenter displays, and as a result, how other methods in this interface are called.

summary.para: Deletes the conflict and removes the from synchronization.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The that is in conflict will no longer be synchronized and the conflict should be deleted.
The value returned in pFeedback determines how the next conflict is resolved. If this method fails, an error message is displayed and the user is asked how to proceed.

summary.para: Exposes methods that manage synchronizing conflicts. Implement this interface to construct a sync conflict handler. The conflict resolution user interface (UI) will call this interface to resolve the conflict presented to the user.
